title.narrative: MOTHER, NEW-BORN AND CHILD HEALTH

description.narrative: The Ministry of Health and Medical Industry strengthens capabilities, the normative base and the tools for planning, costing, implementing, quality-assuring and monitoring services for newborns, young children and mothers, particularly in regions disadvantaged in terms of health outcomes and effects of climate change., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, every newborn, child, adolescent and woman of reproductive age in Turkmenistan, especially those most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from equitable access to high-impact and quality health, nutrition and early childhood development (ECD) services.

participating-org.narrative: ANKARA UNIVERSITESI STRATEJI GELISTIRME DAIRESI BASKANLIGI
MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND MEDICAL INDUSTRY OF TURKMENISTAN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Ministry of Health and Medical Industry strengthens capabilities, the normative base and the tools for planning, costing,implementing, quality-assuring and monitoring services for newborns, young children and mothers, particularly in regionsdisadvantaged in terms of health outcomes and effects of climate change.

description.narrative: Provide a high level statement of progress that speaks directly to the progress made towards the achievement of the results (max.100 words)UNICEF support to health policy development including 2021-2022 National Plan for the Introduction and Distribution of COVID-19 Vaccines and the national RMNCAH Strategy “Healthy Mother – Healthy Child – Healthy Future” for 2021-2025, as well as increased capacity on MCH services and IMCI Programme, coupled with ongoing procurement support for routine immunization and infection prevention, helped to sustain essential mother and child health services and to provide timely COVID-19 pandemic response in 2021. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Costed implementation plan for maternal, newborn and child health care available (21-03-L3-06), Text

baseline.value: Score 2: No. Current Plan ends in 2019. new one for 2020-2030 is drafted.

target.value: 2025:Score 1: The 5-year Action Plan for the new RNMCH Strategy endorsed. Basic Benefit Package costed.

actual.value: 2021:Score 1: The 5-year Action Plan for the new RNMCH Strategy endorsed.
